events.originalText: The Space Shuttle Challenger disintegrated 73 seconds into its tenth mission, killing all seven crew members.
events.subtitle: Space Shuttle Challenger
events.headline: Space Shuttle Challenger disintegrates, killing all seven crew members

events.originalText: Tropical Storm Domoina made landfall in southern Mozambique, causing some of the most severe flooding recorded in the region.
events.subtitle: Tropical Storm Domoina
events.headline: Tropical Storm Domoina causes severe flooding in southern Mozambique

events.originalText: Three U.S. Air Force pilots aboard an unarmed T-39 Sabreliner were killed when the aircraft was shot down over Erfurt, East Germany, by a Soviet MiG-19.
events.subtitle: North American Sabreliner
events.headline: Three U.S. Air Force pilots killed in East Germany by Soviet MiG-19

events.originalText: The Lego Group, a Danish toy company, filed a patent in Denmark for the design of Lego bricks (pictured).
events.subtitle: The Lego Group
events.headline: Lego Group files patent for Lego bricks design in Denmark

events.originalText: The Uline Arena in Washington, D.C., opened to host the Ice Capades.
events.subtitle: Uline Arena
events.headline: Uline Arena opens in Washington, D.C. to host Ice Capades

events.originalText: Choudhry Rahmat Ali published a pamphlet in which he called for the creation of a Muslim state in north-western India that he termed "Pakstan".
events.subtitle: Choudhry Rahmat Ali
events.headline: Choudhry Rahmat Ali calls for creation of Muslim state in India

events.originalText: The largest recorded snowstorm in the history of Washington, D.C., collapsed the Knickerbocker Theatre, killing 98 people.
events.subtitle: Knickerbocker storm
events.headline: Largest snowstorm in D.C. history collapses Knickerbocker Theatre, killing 98

events.originalText: English author Jane Austen's novel Pride and Prejudice was published, using material from an unpublished manuscript originally written between 1796 and 1797.
events.subtitle: Jane Austen
events.headline: Jane Austen's Pride and Prejudice novel published

events.originalText: The word serendipity, derived from the Persian fairy tale The Three Princes of Serendip, was coined by Horace Walpole (pictured) in a letter to a friend.
events.subtitle: Serendipity
events.headline: Word 'serendipity' coined by Horace Walpole

events.originalText: Delegates of the Three Nations of Transylvania adopted the Edict of Torda, allowing local communities to freely elect their preachers in an unprecedented act of religious tolerance.
events.subtitle: Unio Trium Nationum
events.headline: Edict of Torda allows religious tolerance in Transylvania

events.originalText: Nine-year-old EdwardÂ VI, the first English monarch to be raised as a Protestant, became king.
events.subtitle: Edward VI
events.headline: Nine-year-old Edward VI becomes king of England

events.originalText: Despite having saved the southern Song dynasty from attempts by the northern Jin dynasty to conquer it, Chinese general Yue Fei was executed by the Song government.
events.subtitle: Song dynasty
events.headline: Chinese general Yue Fei executed despite saving Song dynasty

events.originalText: Robert de Comines, Earl of Northumbria, was killed in Durham, causing William the Conqueror to embark on a campaign to subjugate northern England.
events.subtitle: Robert de Comines
events.headline: Robert de Comines, Earl of Northumbria, killed in Durham
